name: BMW ///M3 E30 DTM
description:
Deutsche Tourenwagen Meisterschaft 1992. Schnitzer engine specification.

Genuine racing car build at Group A specification using homologated parts.
Major changes include raising front subframe 20mm and rear subframe 12mm. Extensive work using offset parts has been done to retain camber curves and achieve near-zero bumpsteer in the front.

The rear's sweep angle has been changed from 15deg to 12deg, resulting in a milder camber and toe curve under movement. The higher trailing arm angle in the rear retains more anti-squat and moves the position of the camber and toe curve, allowing for a more ideal camber angle to be achieved at the greatly lowered height.

Steering is also faster due to installation of an unassisted circuit racing gearbox.

Alignment is adjustable via camber/caster top up front and adjustable trailing arm joints in the rear.
Main links of the suspension including trailing arm links have been replaced with solid alternatives.
Engine and transmission are built to DTM specification; higher power and 6-speed gearbox.

Setup tip: Tires require quite hard driving to built heat. Don't be afraid of some sliding. Characteristics of tires are different, mainly in compliance
and camber sensitivity. Approximate setups based on Group A manual specs:
Yokohama: Camber -4.0, -4.0 Toe -0.02, 0.09
Pirelli: Camber -2.2, -2.2 Toe -0.02, -0.05

Setup tip: If the course requires driving over very bumpy areas, for example kerbs or in a hillclimb, it might be advisable to lower the rollbar rates. ARBs couple the wheels together, which can cause oscillation of the wheels if the rates are too high for the course's surface.
author: KS and Arch
